ratings.comment: She was okay, nothing special but also not terrible. A lot of work goes into this course although it is also a very informative course, especially for those interested in film and production!The work makes you a better film student, that's for sure. She also put her slides on canvas which was SUPER HELPFUL! and the slides all contained lots of info

There are only 3 graded assignments and 2 exams so it is easy to not put the necessary work into the class. The tests and projects are fair, but graded rather strictly. The topics are very interesting and the professor is helpful and a great lecturer, but don't take this class for an easy A.

Professor B is a great! She is hilarious during lectures and tries to make jokes. Some of the screening are tiring, but overall do not miss them because they appear on the test. Take notes in discussion to help recall things on the tests. Only 2 exams and just study and it will be fine. Lecture sometimes go fast, but they are online.

Don't skip the screenings; they're the only class that counts for attendance aside from discussions. The final paper is graded harshly, but the professor is amazing. She's very much in love with what she does and that shows. Her enthusiasm is infectious even if you don't care for the subject you'll at least love her.
talks way to fast and does not put enough information on the slides

Good professor overall, very caring, post every slide onto Canvas. VERY helpful during office hours. TA's grading can be harsh, especially on the sole paper, but hey ho at least he is helpful and gives me a lot of suggestions. Don't expect this to be an easy A/AB class though.
Professor B is very good at her job, she is very eloquent, and she makes her assignments clear, but the grading criteria is not always clear, and that makes getting an A difficult.

Professor B is one of the best profs I've had so far. CA 350 is a great class, and a large part of that is her teaching. She is very enthusiastic and passionate about the material, which makes each lecture interesting. I have only good things to say about Professor B. She is very nice and approachable, and she gets her concepts across very well.

Professor B is very passionate about the film critics discussed in this course and is eager to hear students' opinions about the readings. However, these readings are very challenging. This class is definitely aimed more towards grad students. If you don't enjoy the first week of class, I would highly recommend dropping this course.

Professor B is very intelligent and passionate about films, and it makes her lectures very engaging. The two projects in the class are difficult to do well on, but the midterm and final are very easy if you go to lecture and screenings. Loved watching a new masterpiece film I'd never/barely heard of each week, makes you passionate about film.

One of my favorite professors at UW-Madison! Really fun and entertaining! There were one or two easy papers and a midterm and final of multiple choice. Some of the films we watched are now my favorites and I have a whole new appreciation and maybe even a new patience when watching films

CA 350 is a great  class, even if you're just kinda into film. It gives you a chance to see classic movies you may not have considered watching before. Maria is clearly knowledgeable on the lecture material and her passion for the subject really shines through. That said, the class is not an easy A. You will have to study and really put effort in.

If you even remotely like film, take this course! Professor B and my TA were magnificent and helpful. Lectures and screenings were great! Some complain about assignments, but those really aren't  too difficult. She tells you exactly what she expects for assignments and even provides study guides for exams. I highly recommend going to office hours!

Maria is one of my favorite professors! She's very quick, and doesn't really allow laptop notes, so be ready to roll if you take this. She's very intelligent and funny as well. Projects in this class are incredibly difficult and you are ill prepared for it. But the exams aren't so horrible! Lectures and screenings were so great though!

Belodubrovskaya is a great professor! She is very passionate about films, and it shows in her lectures. Papers and assignments are kinda tough, but you will leave this class with a new appreciation for movies. Awesome professor overall.  I really enjoyed this class!

This was a great class. Lectures are organized and useful, and the expectations for assignments are very clear. Her sense of humor is subtle but hilarious. If you have a strong interest in film, the class shouldn't be too hard. I took it for fun and it has been one of my favorite classes at UW. And you get to watch awesome films!

Lectures are great! Interesting material with just the right amount of humor. She really lays out what she wants to see in your work for the class assignments and papers and even gives review sheets for the two exams (1 midterm, 1 final).

don't take it unless it's required for your major. She didn't give any hint about the exam, just say whatever I taught in class was fair game. the writing assignment are tough too. kind of ruining my passion for film.

Unless you are intending to become a film major, I do not recommend taking this class. This class kind of ruined movies for me, and most of the students in the class can get very technical and defensive when it comes to films.
I just love her, she loves films and respect them.

She is not very good at answering/ understanding people's questions. But she is very nice and passionate about the class. Tests are easy but other assessments are not. Although it is the TA's that grade those, so kind of luck of the draw I guess...

Very helpful and passionate professor. Assignments are helpful and build Film knowledge. Everything in the class is important for your understanding, but tests aren't overly specific. Kind, approachable, helpful, and informative professor! She did a great job.

Very passionate and intelligent professor.  She explains everything very well and is engaging and makes class interesting.  She's happy to answer questions and talk about anything else in the class.  Great professor!
